intro: Aphanamixis decandra, commonly known as the white sand tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in clustered inflorescences, and it produces edible pods that contain seeds. Aphanamixis decandra is often found in sandy or disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in dry and semi-arid environments.
